CancelContact.name: CancelContact
CancelContact.documentation: Cancels a contact with a specified contact ID.

CreateConfig.name: CreateConfig
CreateConfig.documentation:
Creates a Config with the specified configData parameters.

Only one type of configData can be specified.

CreateDataflowEndpointGroup.name: CreateDataflowEndpointGroup
CreateDataflowEndpointGroup.documentation:
Creates a DataflowEndpoint group containing the specified list of DataflowEndpoint objects.

The name field in each endpoint is used in your mission profile DataflowEndpointConfig to specify which endpoints to use during a contact.

When a contact uses multiple DataflowEndpointConfig objects, each Config must match a DataflowEndpoint in the same group.

CreateMissionProfile.name: CreateMissionProfile
CreateMissionProfile.documentation:
Creates a mission profile.

dataflowEdges is a list of lists of strings. Each lower level list of strings has two elements: a from ARN and a to ARN.

GetAgentConfiguration.name: GetAgentConfiguration
GetAgentConfiguration.documentation:
For use by AWS Ground Station Agent and shouldn't be called directly.

Gets the latest configuration information for a registered agent.

GetConfig.name: GetConfig
GetConfig.documentation:
Returns Config information.

Only one Config response can be returned.

GetMinuteUsage.name: GetMinuteUsage
GetMinuteUsage.documentation: Returns the number of reserved minutes used by account.

ListContacts.name: ListContacts
ListContacts.documentation:
Returns a list of contacts.

If statusList contains AVAILABLE, the request must include groundStation, missionprofileArn, and satelliteArn.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: Returns a list of tags for a specified resource.

RegisterAgent.name: RegisterAgent
RegisterAgent.documentation:
For use by AWS Ground Station Agent and shouldn't be called directly.

Registers a new agent with AWS Ground Station.

UpdateAgentStatus.name: UpdateAgentStatus
UpdateAgentStatus.documentation:
For use by AWS Ground Station Agent and shouldn't be called directly.

Update the status of the agent.

UpdateConfig.name: UpdateConfig
UpdateConfig.documentation:
Updates the Config used when scheduling contacts.

Updating a Config will not update the execution parameters for existing future contacts scheduled with this Config.

UpdateMissionProfile.name: UpdateMissionProfile
UpdateMissionProfile.documentation:
Updates a mission profile.

Updating a mission profile will not update the execution parameters for existing future contacts.

agentCpuCores.documentation: List of CPU cores reserved for the agent.

componentVersions.documentation: List of versions being used by agent components.

instanceId.documentation: ID of EC2 instance agent is running on.

instanceType.documentation: Type of EC2 instance agent is running on.

reservedCpuCores.documentation:
This field should not be used. Use agentCpuCores instead.

List of CPU cores reserved for processes other than the agent running on the EC2 instance.

outputNode.documentation: Name of an antenna demod decode output node used in a contact.

AntennaDemodDecodeDetails.documentation: Details about an antenna demod decode Config used in a contact.

AntennaDownlinkConfig.documentation: Information about how AWS Ground Station should configure an antenna for downlink during a contact.

AntennaDownlinkDemodDecodeConfig.documentation: Information about how AWS Ground Station should conﬁgure an antenna for downlink demod decode during a contact.

transmitDisabled.documentation: Whether or not uplink transmit is disabled.

AntennaUplinkConfig.documentation: Information about the uplink Config of an antenna.

name.documentation: Name string associated with AgentEndpoint. Used as a human-readable identifier for AgentEndpoint.

ComponentStatusData.documentation: Data on the status of agent components.

antennaDemodDecodeDetails.documentation: Details for antenna demod decode Config in a contact.

s3RecordingDetails.documentation: Details for an S3 recording Config in a contact.

ConfigDetails.documentation: Details for certain Config object types in a contact.

ConfigListItem.documentation: An item in a list of Config objects.

antennaDownlinkConfig.documentation: Information about how AWS Ground Station should configure an antenna for downlink during a contact.

antennaDownlinkDemodDecodeConfig.documentation: Information about how AWS Ground Station should conﬁgure an antenna for downlink demod decode during a contact.

antennaUplinkConfig.documentation: Information about how AWS Ground Station should conﬁgure an antenna for uplink during a contact.

trackingConfig.documentation: Object that determines whether tracking should be used during a contact executed with this Config in the mission profile.

uplinkEchoConfig.documentation:
Information about an uplink echo Config.

Parameters from the AntennaUplinkConfig, corresponding to the specified AntennaUplinkConfigArn, are used when this UplinkEchoConfig is used in a contact.

ConfigTypeData.documentation:
Object containing the parameters of a Config.

See the subtype definitions for what each type of Config contains.

mtu.documentation: Maximum transmission unit (MTU) size in bytes of a dataflow endpoint.

ConnectionDetails.documentation: Egress address of AgentEndpoint with an optional mtu.

endTime.documentation: End time of a contact in UTC.

postPassEndTime.documentation: Amount of time after a contact ends that you’d like to receive a CloudWatch event indicating the pass has finished.

prePassStartTime.documentation: Amount of time prior to contact start you’d like to receive a CloudWatch event indicating an upcoming pass.

startTime.documentation: Start time of a contact in UTC.

visibilityEndTime.documentation: Projected time in UTC your satellite will set below the receive mask. This time is based on the satellite's current active ephemeris for future contacts and the ephemeris that was active during contact execution for completed contacts. This field is not present for contacts with a SCHEDULING or SCHEDULED status.

visibilityStartTime.documentation: Projected time in UTC your satellite will rise above the receive mask. This time is based on the satellite's current active ephemeris for future contacts and the ephemeris that was active during contact execution for completed contacts. This field is not present for contacts with a SCHEDULING or SCHEDULED status.

contactPostPassDurationSeconds.documentation: Amount of time, in seconds, after a contact ends that the Ground Station Dataflow Endpoint Group will be in a POSTPASS state. A Ground Station Dataflow Endpoint Group State Change event will be emitted when the Dataflow Endpoint Group enters and exits the POSTPASS state.

contactPrePassDurationSeconds.documentation: Amount of time, in seconds, before a contact starts that the Ground Station Dataflow Endpoint Group will be in a PREPASS state. A Ground Station Dataflow Endpoint Group State Change event will be emitted when the Dataflow Endpoint Group enters and exits the PREPASS state.

endpointDetails.documentation:
Endpoint details of each endpoint in the dataflow endpoint group. 

 All dataflow endpoints within a single dataflow endpoint group must be of the same type. You cannot mix <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/ground-station/latest/APIReference/API_AwsGroundStationAgentEndpoint.html"> AWS Ground Station Agent endpoints</a> with <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/ground-station/latest/APIReference/API_DataflowEndpoint.html">Dataflow endpoints</a> in the same group. If your use case requires both types of endpoints, you must create separate dataflow endpoint groups for each type. </p>

enabled.documentation:
Whether to set the ephemeris status to ENABLED after validation.

Setting this to false will set the ephemeris status to DISABLED after validation.

expirationTime.documentation: An overall expiration time for the ephemeris in UTC, after which it will become EXPIRED.

kmsKeyArn.documentation: The ARN of a KMS key used to encrypt the ephemeris in Ground Station.

name.documentation: A name string associated with the ephemeris. Used as a human-readable identifier for the ephemeris.

priority.documentation:
Customer-provided priority score to establish the order in which overlapping ephemerides should be used.

The default for customer-provided ephemeris priority is 1, and higher numbers take precedence.

Priority must be 1 or greater

satelliteId.documentation: AWS Ground Station satellite ID for this ephemeris.

contactPostPassDurationSeconds.documentation: Amount of time after a contact ends that you’d like to receive a Ground Station Contact State Change event indicating the pass has finished.

contactPrePassDurationSeconds.documentation: Amount of time prior to contact start you’d like to receive a Ground Station Contact State Change event indicating an upcoming pass.

dataflowEdges.documentation: A list of lists of ARNs. Each list of ARNs is an edge, with a from Config and a to Config.

minimumViableContactDurationSeconds.documentation: Smallest amount of time in seconds that you’d like to see for an available contact. AWS Ground Station will not present you with contacts shorter than this duration.

streamsKmsKey.documentation: KMS key to use for encrypting streams.

streamsKmsRole.documentation: Role to use for encrypting streams with KMS key.

DataflowDetail.documentation: Information about a dataflow edge used in a contact.

mtu.documentation: Maximum transmission unit (MTU) size in bytes of a dataflow endpoint.

dataflowList.documentation: List describing source and destination details for each dataflow edge.

endTime.documentation: End time of a contact in UTC.

postPassEndTime.documentation: Amount of time after a contact ends that you’d like to receive a CloudWatch event indicating the pass has finished.

prePassStartTime.documentation: Amount of time prior to contact start you’d like to receive a CloudWatch event indicating an upcoming pass.

startTime.documentation: Start time of a contact in UTC.

visibilityEndTime.documentation: Projected time in UTC your satellite will set below the receive mask. This time is based on the satellite's current active ephemeris for future contacts and the ephemeris that was active during contact execution for completed contacts.

visibilityStartTime.documentation: Projected time in UTC your satellite will rise above the receive mask. This time is based on the satellite's current active ephemeris for future contacts and the ephemeris that was active during contact execution for completed contacts.

creationTime.documentation: The time the ephemeris was uploaded in UTC.

enabled.documentation: Whether or not the ephemeris is enabled.

invalidReason.documentation: Reason that an ephemeris failed validation. Only provided for ephemerides with INVALID status.

name.documentation: A name string associated with the ephemeris. Used as a human-readable identifier for the ephemeris.

priority.documentation:
Customer-provided priority score to establish the order in which overlapping ephemerides should be used.

The default for customer-provided ephemeris priority is 1, and higher numbers take precedence.

Priority must be 1 or greater

satelliteId.documentation: The AWS Ground Station satellite ID associated with ephemeris.

configDetails.documentation: Additional details for a Config, if type is dataflow endpoint or antenna demod decode.

capabilityArns.documentation: List of capabilities to associate with agent.

privateIpAddresses.documentation: List of private IP addresses to associate with agent.

publicIpAddresses.documentation: List of public IP addresses to associate with agent.

value.documentation: Value of an EIRP. Valid values are between 20.0 to 50.0 dBW.

Elevation.documentation: Elevation angle of the satellite in the sky during a contact.

healthReasons.documentation: Health reasons for a dataflow endpoint. This field is ignored when calling CreateDataflowEndpointGroup.

healthStatus.documentation: A dataflow endpoint health status. This field is ignored when calling CreateDataflowEndpointGroup.

securityDetails.documentation: Endpoint security details including a list of subnets, a list of security groups and a role to connect streams to instances.

sourceS3Object.documentation: Source S3 object used for the ephemeris.

creationTime.documentation: The time the ephemeris was uploaded in UTC.

enabled.documentation: Whether or not the ephemeris is enabled.

name.documentation: A name string associated with the ephemeris. Used as a human-readable identifier for the ephemeris.

priority.documentation:
Customer-provided priority score to establish the order in which overlapping ephemerides should be used.

The default for customer-provided ephemeris priority is 1, and higher numbers take precedence.

Priority must be 1 or greater

sourceS3Object.documentation: Source S3 object used for the ephemeris.

ephemerisId.documentation:
UUID of a customer-provided ephemeris.

This field is not populated for default ephemerides from Space Track.

epoch.documentation:
The epoch of a default, ephemeris from Space Track in UTC.

This field is not populated for customer-provided ephemerides.

name.documentation:
A name string associated with the ephemeris. Used as a human-readable identifier for the ephemeris.

A name is only returned for customer-provider ephemerides that have a name associated.

value.documentation: Frequency value. Valid values are between 2200 to 2300 MHz and 7750 to 8400 MHz for downlink and 2025 to 2120 MHz for uplink.

Frequency bandwidth value. AWS Ground Station currently has the following bandwidth limitations:

  • For AntennaDownlinkDemodDecodeconfig, valid values are between 125 kHz to 650 MHz.

  • For AntennaDownlinkconfig, valid values are between 10 kHz to 54 MHz.

  • For AntennaUplinkConfig, valid values are between 10 kHz to 54 MHz.

agentId.documentation: UUID of agent to get configuration information for.

contactPostPassDurationSeconds.documentation: Amount of time, in seconds, after a contact ends that the Ground Station Dataflow Endpoint Group will be in a POSTPASS state. A Ground Station Dataflow Endpoint Group State Change event will be emitted when the Dataflow Endpoint Group enters and exits the POSTPASS state.

contactPrePassDurationSeconds.documentation: Amount of time, in seconds, before a contact starts that the Ground Station Dataflow Endpoint Group will be in a PREPASS state. A Ground Station Dataflow Endpoint Group State Change event will be emitted when the Dataflow Endpoint Group enters and exits the PREPASS state.

tags.documentation: Tags assigned to a dataflow endpoint group.

month.documentation: The month being requested, with a value of 1-12.

year.documentation: The year being requested, in the format of YYYY.

estimatedMinutesRemaining.documentation: Estimated number of minutes remaining for an account, specific to the month being requested.

isReservedMinutesCustomer.documentation: Returns whether or not an account has signed up for the reserved minutes pricing plan, specific to the month being requested.

totalReservedMinuteAllocation.documentation: Total number of reserved minutes allocated, specific to the month being requested.

totalScheduledMinutes.documentation: Total scheduled minutes for an account, specific to the month being requested.

upcomingMinutesScheduled.documentation: Upcoming minutes scheduled for an account, specific to the month being requested.

contactPostPassDurationSeconds.documentation: Amount of time after a contact ends that you’d like to receive a CloudWatch event indicating the pass has finished.

contactPrePassDurationSeconds.documentation: Amount of time prior to contact start you’d like to receive a CloudWatch event indicating an upcoming pass.

dataflowEdges.documentation: A list of lists of ARNs. Each list of ARNs is an edge, with a from Config and a to Config.

minimumViableContactDurationSeconds.documentation: Smallest amount of time in seconds that you’d like to see for an available contact. AWS Ground Station will not present you with contacts shorter than this duration.

streamsKmsKey.documentation: KMS key to use for encrypting streams.

streamsKmsRole.documentation: Role to use for encrypting streams with KMS key.

currentEphemeris.documentation: The current ephemeris being used to compute the trajectory of the satellite.

groundStations.documentation: A list of ground stations to which the satellite is on-boarded.

IntegerRange.documentation: An integer range that has a minimum and maximum value.

InvalidParameterException.documentation: One or more parameters are not valid.

nextToken.documentation: Next token returned in the request of a previous ListConfigs call. Used to get the next page of results.
Next token returned in the response of a previous ListConfigs call. Used to get the next page of results.

endTime.documentation: End time of a contact in UTC.

nextToken.documentation: Next token returned in the request of a previous ListContacts call. Used to get the next page of results.

startTime.documentation: Start time of a contact in UTC.

nextToken.documentation: Next token returned in the response of a previous ListContacts call. Used to get the next page of results.

maxResults.documentation: Maximum number of dataflow endpoint groups returned.

nextToken.documentation: Next token returned in the request of a previous ListDataflowEndpointGroups call. Used to get the next page of results.
Next token returned in the response of a previous ListDataflowEndpointGroups call. Used to get the next page of results.

endTime.documentation: The end time to list in UTC. The operation will return an ephemeris if its expiration time is within the time range defined by the startTime and endTime.

satelliteId.documentation: The AWS Ground Station satellite ID to list ephemeris for.

startTime.documentation: The start time to list in UTC. The operation will return an ephemeris if its expiration time is within the time range defined by the startTime and endTime.

statusList.documentation: The list of ephemeris status to return.

nextToken.documentation: Next token that can be supplied in the next call to get the next page of ground stations.

satelliteId.documentation: Satellite ID to retrieve on-boarded ground stations.

nextToken.documentation: Next token that can be supplied in the next call to get the next page of ground stations.
Next token returned in the request of a previous ListMissionProfiles call. Used to get the next page of results.
Next token returned in the response of a previous ListMissionProfiles call. Used to get the next page of results.
Next token that can be supplied in the next call to get the next page of satellites.
Next token that can be supplied in the next call to get the next page of satellites.

MissionProfileListItem.documentation: Item in a list of mission profiles.

oemData.documentation: The data for an OEM ephemeris, supplied directly in the request rather than through an S3 object.

s3Object.documentation: Identifies the S3 object to be used as the ephemeris.

OEMEphemeris.documentation:
Ephemeris data in Orbit Ephemeris Message (OEM) format.

AWS Ground Station processes OEM Customer Provided Ephemerides according to the CCSDS standard with some extra restrictions. OEM files should be in KVN format. For more detail about the OEM format that AWS Ground Station supports, see OEM ephemeris format in the AWS Ground Station user guide.

mtu.documentation: Maximum transmission unit (MTU) size in bytes of a dataflow endpoint.

RangedConnectionDetails.documentation: Ingress address of AgentEndpoint with a port range and an optional mtu.

RangedSocketAddress.documentation: A socket address with a port range.

agentDetails.documentation: Detailed information about the agent being registered.

discoveryData.documentation: Data for associating an agent with the capabilities it is managing.

endTime.documentation: End time of a contact in UTC.

startTime.documentation: Start time of a contact in UTC.

ResourceLimitExceededException.documentation: Account limits for this resource have been exceeded.

key.documentation: An Amazon S3 key for the ephemeris.

version.documentation: For versioned S3 objects, the version to use for the ephemeris.

S3Object.documentation: Object stored in S3 containing ephemeris data.

bucketArn.documentation: ARN of the bucket to record to.

prefix.documentation: S3 Key prefix to prefice data files.

roleArn.documentation: ARN of the role Ground Station assumes to write data to the bucket.

keyTemplate.documentation: Key template used for the S3 Recording Configuration

S3RecordingDetails.documentation: Details about an S3 recording Config used in a contact.

currentEphemeris.documentation: The current ephemeris being used to compute the trajectory of the satellite.

groundStations.documentation: A list of ground stations to which the satellite is on-boarded.

roleArn.documentation: ARN to a role needed for connecting streams to your instances.

securityGroupIds.documentation: The security groups to attach to the elastic network interfaces.

subnetIds.documentation: A list of subnets where AWS Ground Station places elastic network interfaces to send streams to your instances.

configDetails.documentation: Additional details for a Config, if type is dataflow-endpoint or antenna-downlink-demod-decode

bandwidth.documentation:
Bandwidth of a spectral Config. AWS Ground Station currently has the following bandwidth limitations:

  • For AntennaDownlinkDemodDecodeconfig, valid values are between 125 kHz to 650 MHz.

  • For AntennaDownlinkconfig valid values are between 10 kHz to 54 MHz.

  • For AntennaUplinkConfig, valid values are between 10 kHz to 54 MHz.

centerFrequency.documentation: Center frequency of a spectral Config. Valid values are between 2200 to 2300 MHz and 7750 to 8400 MHz for downlink and 2025 to 2120 MHz for uplink.

polarization.documentation: Polarization of a spectral Config. Capturing both "RIGHT_HAND" and "LEFT_HAND" polarization requires two separate configs.

tleLine1.documentation: First line of two-line element set (TLE) data.

tleLine2.documentation: Second line of two-line element set (TLE) data.

validTimeRange.documentation: The valid time range for the TLE. Gaps or overlap are not permitted.

s3Object.documentation: Identifies the S3 object to be used as the ephemeris.

tleData.documentation: The data for a TLE ephemeris, supplied directly in the request rather than through an S3 object.

endTime.documentation: Time in UTC at which the time range ends.

startTime.documentation: Time in UTC at which the time range starts.

TimeRange.documentation: A time range with a start and end time.

TrackingConfig.documentation: Object that determines whether tracking should be used during a contact executed with this Config in the mission profile.

enabled.documentation: Whether the ephemeris is enabled or not. Changing this value will not require the ephemeris to be re-validated.

name.documentation: A name string associated with the ephemeris. Used as a human-readable identifier for the ephemeris.

priority.documentation:
Customer-provided priority score to establish the order in which overlapping ephemerides should be used.

The default for customer-provided ephemeris priority is 1, and higher numbers take precedence.

Priority must be 1 or greater

contactPostPassDurationSeconds.documentation: Amount of time after a contact ends that you’d like to receive a Ground Station Contact State Change event indicating the pass has finished.

contactPrePassDurationSeconds.documentation: Amount of time after a contact ends that you’d like to receive a Ground Station Contact State Change event indicating the pass has finished.

dataflowEdges.documentation: A list of lists of ARNs. Each list of ARNs is an edge, with a from Config and a to Config.

minimumViableContactDurationSeconds.documentation: Smallest amount of time in seconds that you’d like to see for an available contact. AWS Ground Station will not present you with contacts shorter than this duration.

streamsKmsKey.documentation: KMS key to use for encrypting streams.

streamsKmsRole.documentation: Role to use for encrypting streams with KMS key.

enabled.documentation: Whether or not an uplink Config is enabled.

UplinkEchoConfig.documentation:
Information about an uplink echo Config.

Parameters from the AntennaUplinkConfig, corresponding to the specified AntennaUplinkConfigArn, are used when this UplinkEchoConfig is used in a contact.

centerFrequency.documentation: Center frequency of an uplink spectral Config. Valid values are between 2025 to 2120 MHz.

polarization.documentation: Polarization of an uplink spectral Config. Capturing both "RIGHT_HAND" and "LEFT_HAND" polarization requires two separate configs.

documentation: Welcome to the AWS Ground Station API Reference. AWS Ground Station is a fully managed service that enables you to control satellite communications, downlink and process satellite data, and scale your satellite operations efficiently and cost-effectively without having to build or manage your own ground station infrastructure.
